Recap: Doris drops the charges against Tammy but refuses to do the same with Jonathan. Tammy wonders out loud if Cassie had anything to do with it. Doris calls Tammy to the stand to testify against Jonathan and Jonathan admits to take full responsibility if she will just stop hammering Tammy. Sandy interrupts saying that he was the owner of the house and that he knows what happened. On the stand, he admits it was actually his fault after getting angry by seeing Tammy and Jonathan together again. The judge dismisses the charges against Jonathan and Tammy thanks Sandy. Jonathan also thanks him but Sandy tells him that he owes him. Reva correctly guesses that Jeffrey had something to do with Sandy's testimony. Harley and Dinah discuss Mallet and Harley's past while in Mallet's house in Florida. Harley tells Dinah that they both are different people now and although he cheated on her, she doesn't think he would do the same to Dinah. A man shows up claiming that he gave Alan money, but when he asks for the money back in return, Harley throws him to the floor and tells him that Alan is claustrophobic and his story doesn't ring true. Alan lies unconscious on a floor somewhere. Edmund tells Cassie more about Jeffrey's past posing as Richard and asks her if he ever pretends to be Richard in bed. Cassie slaps him and Josh must pull her out of the cell. Jeffrey comes home from the trial and walks into a dark house to find Cassie waiting for him.
Transcript: Doris: You want to save Tammy Winslow, go ahead and make me an offer. The thing is, you don't have anything I want.
Jeffrey: Actually, I do have something you want. I have a job that you want, my job.
Doris: You can't be serious.
Jeffrey: I will smooth things over with the mayor. I will make sure you become the next district attorney of Springfield. You drop the charges against Tammy.
Doris: Deal.
Bailiff: We are back in session, please.
Doris: Your Honor, the people, after some consideration have decided to drop any and all charges against Tammy Winslow.
Judge: It is so ordered. Ms. Winslow, you are free to go.
Tammy: It's over. It is over.
Reva: What about Jonathan?
Doris: The people, however, will not extend the same consideration to the defendant, Jonathan Randall. We intend to pursue prosecution for all charges as they stand.
Tammy: No, you can't! Did my mother put you up to this?
Jonathan: Tammy.
Tammy: No, you can't. Jonathan didn't do anything wrong.
Reva: No, I don't understand.
Tammy: This isn't right, it's not fair.
Jonathan: Hey, stop. It's over.
Reva: Jeffrey, what about Jonathan? ( Gavel banging ) ( everyone talking at once )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: So you turned in your badge?
Mallet: Temporarily, I just figured I'd be able to do more good working Gus's disappearance from the outside.
Frank: Who was that on the phone?
Mallet: Someone who owes me a favor.
Buzz: You're going through an awful lot for my daughter.
Mallet: Gus is my partner, Buzz.
Buzz: No, I'm just being appreciative. Hopefully when she comes back she'll have good news.
Mallet: Back from where?
Buzz: Uh, nowhere. I... ( stammering )
Mallet: Uh, Buzz?

Harley: Oh, watch your step.
Dinah: Okay. Whoa.
Harley: Dinah.
Dinah: Wow. So this is where you and Mallet lived when you were married?

Dinah: Harley. Come on.
Harley: Come on what?
Dinah: Stop being so cool. You know, I know that this place must have a lot of memories for you. I mean, memories of you and Mallet when you loved each other.

Edmund: So, who do you imagine is responsible for ruining your life? I'll give you a hint, Cassie. It's not me. Dinah played you, yes, but Jeffrey O'Neill was her Richard. So, tell me, what does that make Jeffrey O'Neill to you now?
Cassie: Don't you ever get tired of lying, Edmund.
Edmund: Every word is true.
Josh: All right. This... this was a mistake. I don't know why we thought we could get anything of value from you.
Edmund: That's a good point, considering you're the ones who left me chained in here like a dog. Nonetheless, everything I'm saying is the truth.
Josh: There's no reason to be here right now. Come on. Let's go.

Edmund: It's the truth, Cassie. Who had the connections to have Dinah released from prison to set her up in Europe with the means of impersonating you? Jeffrey, Cassie. Jeffrey O'Neill, your knight in shining armor. He will do anything and everything it takes to get what he wants, and that includes you.

( Everyone talking at once ) ( gavel banging )

Jeffrey: I don't know what you are talking about.
Reva: No, I love Tammy, too, but you can't just leave Jonathan hanging. Jeffrey.
Jeffrey: Excuse me, I have to take care of something. You shouldn't be in here.
Tammy: This isn't right.
Jonathan: Tammy, you need to stop worrying about me.
Tammy: No, they can't take you away from me.
Jonathan: Hey, all that matters is that you're okay.

Jonathan: Yes.

Doris: Thank you, your Honor. The people would like to call Tammy Winslow to the stand.

Dinah: I got to say, it just like you never really left.

Mallet: Well, thanks for letting me know about the Florida thing, I hope it pans out.

You're not going to phone Harley and grill her? You're not going to get on a plane and go down to Florida?

Mallet: You know what, Buzz? I don't know. Maybe I wised up. You know, maybe I can put my energy to good use here.

Dinah: Look, you don't have to convince me how much you love Gus. And I know that you love Mallet in a very sort of-- a different way. And Mallet loves you in a different way, also, because you love Gus.

Dinah: I'm saying... I'm saying what you've been saying, that I feel that Mallet has room in his heart for me, and I'm really happy about that.
Harley: I'm glad, because everybody deserves a chance to feel what Gus and I had-- have had-- have. What do I do? Here we are following this great lead and I keep saying things like have.
Dinah: Well, you don't mean it.
Harley: No I don't, because Marina's source said that Alan was spotted at the Pelican Club where we know that he has a condo.
Dinah: Yeah, but he was found on the ground.

Harley: I know what you're thinking, that Alan was hurt possibly seriously all the way up north, and here we are all the way here. What are the chances he'd be here? You think it's a bogus lead, right?
Dinah: You know what? You're the cop, and a damn good one, and I'm here to support you.
Harley: So, you think we're wasting time following a lead when they're probably a thousand miles away?
Dinah: I think that Alan could be here, yeah.

Harley: You know what I'm going to do when I find Gus? I'm going to smack him in the mouth because I don't know what he's thinking. Okay, so you want to be my big hero. Fine. That's fine, that's a guy thing, but you can't leave me a clue, just a hint where you might be just in case you don't come back. What is he thinking? I'm his wife. I deserve better than that!
Dinah: Harley.
Harley: Where is he? Dinah, where is he?

Cassie: Okay, so Jeffrey knew Richard, maybe he even put on his uniform for security reasons.

Taught her how to dress like you, how to act like you. He put her up in the finest hotels. He gave her a diamond tiara, just like yours. An identical red velvet cape, you saw the damn thing yourself. She played you in Paris, London and Rome. Jeffrey and Dinah played prince and princess at your expense and they made quite a pair.
Cassie: No. No way. He would have told me.
Edmund: Of course he would have. Just as he has told you everything else about himself.
Josh: Cassie.

Edmund: Please. ( Laughs ) Please. I understand you don't believe me. Don't take my word for it. Ask around. Your friends, your friends in Washington, D.C., Ask them. As them questions. Dinah: Well, what doesn't kill you, makes you stronger. No, I mean, you know that's why I didn't want to have anything to do with men. You know, I swore them off. Didn't want to get into trouble, and then that knuckle-head Mallet had to put his mug in my life.

Nicole and Bradley, inside "The Light." Taking on the role of Cassie... personally for me it's an adventure. Cassie is a little bit black and white. I think she's an extremist. Archie: Yeah. He asked me if he could borrow some money. Given his reputation, I was kind of surprised, but then he said he was in an accident, lost everything.

Archie: You know, I figured a guy like Mr. Spaulding, I would get it back three-fold. Could you possibly reimburse me? You know for now? I'll run over and pay the caterer. I'll be back here in ten minutes and then we can go to the shed.
Harley: How much?

Archie: That's fine, as long as you know, you can give me the rest tomorrow.
Harley: Of course, that's not a problem at all. So this shed, it's small, huh? And kind of a dark place, I bet?
Archie: Yeah, perfect place to hide out, exactly what Mr. Spaulding said he was looking for.
Harley: Yeah, I bet. ( Grunts )
Archie: ( Grunts )
Harley: Archie, Archie, Archie. Why do you lie to me? Why?

Gus: I'm talking to you. Out of the two of us, I always thought you were the guy with more manners. If you want to find me-- and believe me, I've got my doubts that you do-- you've got to think like me. You want to show some respect, I'm a missing person for crying out loud.

Sandy: As I was approaching the house that night, I saw Tammy and Jonathan running away from it. I thought this was a bit weird, so I went to check things out, and the first thing I saw was a fire that someone had put out-- or at least I thought they had. And standing there in my house, seeing this pile of ashes, and having just seen Tammy and Jonathan together again, I got a little upset. And suffice it to say, I ended up throwing a poker in the fireplace, and went to check the rest of the house out, to see if it was all right. By the time I got back to the living room, I was shocked to see that the rug was on fire. And not just smoldering, flames were shooting up, and I quick grabbed the cover from the coach to smother it, and it caught fire, too, and I freaked. And I'm not proud of it, but I couldn't think of anything but to get out of there, and I just left the place, and it was still burning. I know that I should have said something earlier, and I apologize for that. the truth is, I enjoyed watching Jonathan sweat it out. But I can't let him go to prison for something he didn't do. Jonathan did not purposely set that house on fire. It was just a bizarre set of circumstances, and it's really no one's fault.

Sandy: Maybe.

Sandy: Okay. All right. Well, how do you propose I do that?
Jeffrey: That's up to you. But I will tell you this, if you know anything that can get Jonathan off the hook right now, it's a good time to come forward. You give me way too much credit, Reva.

Tammy: Excuse me. There's um... there's something! I have to do. Sandy. Thank you.

Buzz: Oh, yeah, I have a closet full of them.
Mallet: No, those are skeletons, I mean ghosts. You know, like real ghosts.
Buzz: I haven't given it much thought, why?

Mallet: Uh... nothing. No reason. I've always been kind of a rational guy, you know. I believe in things that I can touch and things I can see with my own eyes. And I... I don't know, maybe there's just a lot of stuff that we can't explain, you ever think about that? Maybe some stuff that we just feel? Hey, thanks for the coffee, I've got to go. Thanks, Buzz.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: I think Gus is out there. I believe he is trying to reach me. And he's trying to tell me something. I just don't know what it is.
Dinah: Maybe he's down here in Florida, you know. Maybe he's even out on that beach somewhere.
Harley: He's so close to me, I could almost... I could almost touch him.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: I don't know why you did that?
Sandy: I care about you, Tammy. And as much as I think he is wrong for you, I know that it would tear you apart if Jonathan went to prison. I did this for you, not for him.
Jonathan: Hey. Um, I don't know what that was about in there, but... thank you.
Sandy: No problem.
Jonathan: Yeah. Sandy:( Whispers ) You owe me. You two take care.
Tammy: Jonathan, you okay?
Jonathan: Me? Yeah. It's great, it's great. It's over. Let's get out of here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Joshua.
Josh: The charges were dismissed?
Reva: Yeah, against both of them. And it was all thanks to Jeffrey. He won't take any credit for it, but I hope Cassie is aware of what kind of a man she's got in Jeffrey O'Neill.
Josh: I think she has a pretty good idea.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jeffrey: Cassie, I hope you're awake because I've got some good news. What are you doing? Why are you in the dark?
Cassie: I'm not in the dark. Maybe I was, but I'm not anymore.

Woman: Ms. Winslow?

Woman: You're in love with your own cousin.
Cassie: Well isn't that just the question of the hour. Tell me when you were going to trust me with the truth.
